We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic''

==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is 'Singapore' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is 'Asia/Calcutta' 
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== datetime == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== datetime == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== datetime == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== datetime == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

[[#Top]]

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== datetime == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== datetime == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== datetime == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

	count+=1

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== datetime == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

	count+=1

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

[[#Top]] Let's print them line by line and we want to get idea also how many total are there. 
import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] =Use calendar library=

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library==

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

[[#Top]] Let's print them line by line and we want to get idea also how many total are there. 
import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library.

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

[[#Top]] Let's print them line by line and we want to get idea also how many total are there. 
import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Thursday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 0- Sunday 1- Monday 1- Tuesday 2- Wednesday 4- Thursday 5- Friday 6- Saturday

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

[[#Top]] Let's print them line by line and we want to get idea also how many total are there. 
import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Thursday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 
0- Sunday
1- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
4- Thursday
5- Friday
6- Saturday

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Thursday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 
0- Sunday
1- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
4- Thursday
5- Friday
6- Saturday

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Thursday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 
0- Sunday
1- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
4- Thursday
5- Friday
6- Saturday

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Thursday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday
== Get time of all Time Zones == 
from datetime import datetime as dt
import pytz

timezones=pytz.all_timezones

for i in range(len(timezones)):
    zone=timezone[i]
    tz=pytz.timezone(zone)
    print("Current time at  zone", zone, " is : ", dt.now(tz))

revision.comment: /* Get time of all Time Zones */
revision.text:
=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

[[#Top]] Let's print them line by line and we want to get idea also how many total are there. 
import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday
== Get time of all Time Zones == 
from datetime import datetime as dt
import pytz

timezones=pytz.all_timezones

for i in range(len(timezones)):
    zone=timezone[i]
    tz=pytz.timezone(zone)
    print("Current time at  zone", zone, " is : ", dt.now(tz))

revision.comment: /* Get time of all Time Zones */
revision.text:
=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday
== Get time of all Time Zones == 
from datetime import datetime as dt
import pytz

timezones=pytz.all_timezones

for i in range(len(timezones)):
    zone=timezone[i]
    tz=pytz.timezone(zone)
    print("Current time at  zone", zone, " is : ", dt.now(tz))

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi How to automate a browser for WHATSAPP. =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

['Africa/Abidjan', 'Africa/Accra', 'Africa/Addis_Ababa', 'Africa/Algiers', 'Africa/Asmara', 'Africa/Asmera', 'Africa/Bamako', 'Africa/Bangui', 'Africa/Banjul', 'Africa/Bissau', 'Africa/Blantyre', 'Africa/Brazzaville', 'Africa/Bujumbura', 'Africa/Cairo', 'Africa/Casablanca', 'Africa/Ceuta', 'Africa/Conakry', 'Africa/Dakar', 'Africa/Dar_es_Salaam', 'Africa/Djibouti', 'Africa/Douala', 'Africa/El_Aaiun', 'Africa/Freetown', 'Africa/Gaborone', 'Africa/Harare', 'Africa/Johannesburg', 'Africa/Juba', 'Africa/Kampala', 'Africa/Khartoum', 'Africa/Kigali', 'Africa/Kinshasa', 'Africa/Lagos', import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday
== Get time of all Time Zones == 
from datetime import datetime as dt
import pytz

timezones=pytz.all_timezones

for i in range(len(timezones)):
    zone=timezone[i]
    tz=pytz.timezone(zone)
    print("Current time at  zone", zone, " is : ", dt.now(tz))

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi How to automate a browser for WHATSAPP. This we can do using Python library viz.selenium. Install it in your system. '''On UBUNTU:''' 
pip3 install selenium
'''On Windows: ''' 
python -m pip install selenium
=Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

[[#Top]] Let's print them line by line and we want to get idea also how many total are there. 
import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday
== Get time of all Time Zones == 
from datetime import datetime as dt
import pytz

timezones=pytz.all_timezones

for i in range(len(timezones)):
    zone=timezone[i]
    tz=pytz.timezone(zone)
    print("Current time at  zone", zone, " is : ", dt.now(tz))

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi How to automate a browser for WHATSAPP. This we can do using Python library viz.selenium. Install it in your system. '''On UBUNTU:''' 
pip3 install selenium
'''On Windows: ''' 
python -m pip install selenium
'''Install Webdriver for browser:''' Search for ''installing webdriver for chrome'' in Google. =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

[[#Top]] Let's print them line by line and we want to get idea also how many total are there. 
import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday
== Get time of all Time Zones == 
from datetime import datetime as dt
import pytz

timezones=pytz.all_timezones

for i in range(len(timezones)):
    zone=timezone[i]
    tz=pytz.timezone(zone)
    print("Current time at  zone", zone, " is : ", dt.now(tz))

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi How to automate a browser for WHATSAPP. This we can do using Python library viz.selenium. Install it in your system. '''On UBUNTU:''' 
pip3 install selenium
'''On Windows: ''' 
python -m pip install selenium
'''Install Webdriver for browser:''' Search for ''installing webdriver for chrome'' in Google. Click on the link for ''ChromeDriver - WebDriver for Chrome'' and download it. =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)

[[#Top]] Let's print them line by line and we want to get idea also how many total are there. 
import pytz
count=1
for i in pytz.all_timezones:
	print(count,":",i)
	count+=1

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday
== Get time of all Time Zones == 
from datetime import datetime as dt
import pytz

timezones=pytz.all_timezones

for i in range(len(timezones)):
    zone=timezone[i]
    tz=pytz.timezone(zone)
    print("Current time at  zone", zone, " is : ", dt.now(tz))

=Browser Automation Whatsapp = Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi How to automate a browser for WHATSAPP. This we can do using Python library viz.selenium. Install it in your system. '''On UBUNTU:''' 
pip3 install selenium
'''On Windows: ''' 
python -m pip install selenium
'''Install Webdriver for browser:''' Search for ''installing webdriver for chrome'' in Google. Click on the link for ''ChromeDriver - WebDriver for Chrome'' and download it. [[File:chromeDriver.png]] =Fun with Calendar= Taught by Vidyamam, Edited by Ms. Ami Tusharkant Choksi [[File:calendar1.jpg]] We want to get date, time and year of today. If we are calling our friend, in Paris, what time will be there just now. Whether your friend will be able to talk or not. Should we call at the current time or not? All these questions will be solved using ''Calendar Arithmetic'' Libraries we will use are:
  1. calendar
  2. datetime
  3. pytz
== Get Date & Time of your timezone == '''Current Date and Time:''' We are running the following code on Python shell. 
#import datetime library
>>> from datetime import datetime as dt
#get today's date and current time.
>>> dt.now()
datetime.datetime(2018, 10, 11, 15, 33, 48, 616382)  #The output is, date and time in the 
format of (yyyy, mm, dd, HH, MM, SS, MS) get today's date and current time in proper 
format of. MS is milliseconds.  
>>> print(dt.now())
2018-10-11 15:34:32.526894 #The output is, date and time properly formatted, i.e.
yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS.MS   ;  MS is milliseconds.
==Timezone using pytz== We want to get date and time of today, as per the particular timezone. Some timezones are defined according to country's name, e.g. for Singapore it is '''Singapore''' whereas for others, it is from continent and major city in the country. e.g.for India, it is '''Asia/Calcutta''' '''Get the date and time of Singapore just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of Singapore just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Singapore')
print(dt.now(tz))#print date and time of today, as per the particular timezone
#Output: 2018-10-11 18:33:08.439114+08:00
#+8:00 is Time of Singapore is 8 hours ahead of GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)
'''Get the date and time of India just now''' ---- 
#get the date and time of India just now.
tz=pytz.timezone('Asia/Calcutta')
print(dt.now(tz))
#Output: 2018-10-11 16:11:26.149791+05:30
'''Get the list of all timezones''' 
print(pytz.all_timezones)
Output is:

'''Total timezones are available is : 591''' [[#Top]] ==Use calendar library== What will be the day on a particular date, we can find using ''calendar'' library. 
import calendar
calendar.weekday(2018,7,6)
#Output: 4,i.e. Friday.
'''Explanation of Output''': ---- 

0- Monday
1- Tuesday
2- Wednesday
3- Thursday
4- Friday
5- Saturday
6- Sunday
'''Find day on a particular valid date''' ---- 
def get_day(day_index):
    days=['Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday', 'Friday','Saturday','Sunday']
    return(days[day_index])


import  calendar
year=2018
month=8
date=7
day_index=calendar.weekday(year,month,date)
print("On ",date,"-",month,"-",year," is: ",get_day(day_index))
Output is : 
On  7 - 8 - 2018  is:  Tuesday
== Get time of all Time Zones == 
from datetime import datetime as dt
import pytz

timezones=pytz.all_timezones

for i in range(len(timezones)):
    zone=timezone[i]
    tz=pytz.timezone(zone)
    print("Current time at  zone", zone, " is : ", dt.now(tz))
